body_html:
It should work in the nightlies, if you have a full stack trace and minimal graph/code to replicate that would be helpful.
…
On Sun, Oct 15, 2017, 8:54 PM Edward Bordin ***@***.***> wrote: It will still be useful in scenarios where you don't need the gradient. As a workaround I'd suggest enabling soft placement so the gradient ops can be placed on CPU. I did get some CUDA kernel launch errors with the new implementation but that would be a totally separate issue. Still haven't had time to prepare a proper bug report (it could have been fixed in the meantime anyway) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned.  placed on CPU.

 I did get some CUDA kernel launch errors with the new implementation but

body:
It should work in the nightlies, if you have a full stack trace and minimal
graph/code to replicate that would be helpful.

On Sun, Oct 15, 2017, 8:54 PM Edward Bordin <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> It will still be useful in scenarios where you don't need the gradient. As
> a workaround I'd suggest enabling soft placement so the gradient ops can be
> placed on CPU.
>
> I did get some CUDA kernel launch errors with the new implementation but
> that would be a totally separate issue. Still haven't had time to prepare a
> proper bug report (it could have been fixed in the meantime anyway)
